Articles.Content:
Starting this up again, going to film the tutorials over again with proper commentating and some background music!

First video is up and ready, I will be posting all the new videos in this thread as I film them.

If you have a tip or trick you want added to the list, let me know!

Part 1: Using Multi-Docking port connections in the VAB

Part 2:Asparagus Staging for Beginners!

Part 3:Onion Staging for Beginners!

Part 4:Pancake Staging! (And why you should probably not use it)

Part 5:Docking two ships with no RCS using MechJeb!

The Full Playlist is on my channel

Edited May 29, 2013 by HoY
Looks quite useful. I've gone ahead and added this series to my little list, assuming you don't mind.

Thank you, and of course I don't mind!

I'm going to stick quite closely to the construction aspects of the game for my videos, as there are already many people helping with the other thing like piloting, docking, and orbital mechanics. I know a lot of the tricks with the VAB and SPH it's just a matter of making them presentable

No problem It's good to a series that specializes in one area, especially for teaching more advanced concepts and tricks to players who already know what they're doing generally but are looking for new ways to get even better.

Got a question. Do people want to see more MechJeb tutorials or construction method tutorials? I have a lot more of both I have been thinking about recording, but with my work schedule I need to pick and choose which I do first
I'd probably do the construction method tutorials first, since they're more applicable to a broader audience. Not everyone uses MechJeb, after all.

Alright I think I can manage that. I'll try to get another one out tonight instead of just playing and working on my own space program lol. Or two actually. Engine clustering and populating are both easy enough. I'll tackle some other more complicated VAB tricks coming up after these
I really enjoyed your videos, they are clear and to the point. I found them very helpful when I was new to the game (which was recently). Are you still going to continue the series?

I absolutely am! I'm currently on the other side of the country with my family until July 4'th (I live quite far away for work)

That was the reason I wanted to make my own tutorial videos. I've seen a lot of videos from people that are trying to teach or show something but they spend a little too much time trying to make the video into something more than instructional. Plus I have a little trouble with certain accents, so a Canadian who speaks with an American accent should be fairly easy for anyone to understand lol.

If I could send my thanks in some physical way, I would. I have just gotten the game and have simply been attaching rockets and launching, playing around with what it takes to get into orbit. Your construction videos are an eye-opener and not something that a newbie can think of themselves. So, I very much appreciate you taking the time and effort to put these together. BIG help from here at the Kerbal Space Innovators Program in Tampa Bay.
Glad they helped make sure you subscribe to the YouTube channel to see the updates as I post them
One more week then I'll be home again. I'll push out the two more construction videos then I have several MechJeb and Kethane tutorials I'd like to share!
